question: Coverage options for people with disabilities
text:
Coverage options for people with disabilities
          
        
If you have a disability, you have a number of options for health coverage with Pennie.
If you have a disability and currently have Medicaid or Medicare you're considered covered under the health care law and don't need a Pennie plan.
However, if you have a disability, dont qualify for disability benefits and need health coverage, Pennie encourages you to create a Pennie account on Pennie.com and fill out a Pennie health coverage enrollment application. This is the best way to find out if you qualify for a private health plan with premium tax credits and other financial assistance based on your income.
Call the Pennie Contact Center if you need assistance in creating your Pennie account and filling out your enrollment application by calling 1-844-844-8040.
People with disabilities have rights and protections under the health care law, including coverage for pre-existing conditions, no annual or lifetime coverage limits, and free preventive care.
